term.name: Cartesianism
term.source: From the name of the French philosopher Rene Descartes (1596–1650).
term.def: Descartes is often considered the founder of modern philosophy (although his ideas owed much to medieval thinkers such as Avicenna). The signature ideas of Cartesianism are &dualism;, &rationalism;, and the mind-body dichotomy (i.e., a combination of &idealism; in the spiritual realm and of &mechanism; in the physical realm).
